div.p:
It-taṉmam celuttuka Itu
panṉmā Ecuvar rekṣai

In the name of our army commander ceṉāpatikaḷ, this land is given so that the hereditary rights of the land kāṇi of our army commander which belonged to the landholder uṭaiyār from Rājarāja Paṅkala-nāṭu, alias Kaṇṭarātittaṉ Ceṭṭi of the court of king Kōṉerimaikoṇṭāṉ are transferred to the managers of the sacred temple cikāriyañ ceyvārkaḷ of Tiruvāṉpaṭṭi-uṭaiyār.

For the Paṅkuṉi festival dedicated to this God, he gave to Viṇṇāḷaṉ (?) three pots of paddy seeds obtained from the plot to the east of the Koṅkakulavalli cross-channel and north of the Atirācarāca canal in Civapāta-cēkara Maṉṉaṟai located in Nallūr. This is a plot under the charge of Nācci (?) and the assembly of Vīrakeraḷa Nallūr, alias Kovanputtūr, in Pērūr-nāṭu.

This was given so the expenses amounting to twenty-four pots of paddy claimed by the landholder mēlvāram are covered by twenty pots of paddy seeds:
For the maṭam, one tūṇi, one patakkuthis would be half kalam. , and one kalam of paddy, which includes four side dishes veñcaṉam, one tūṇi and one paṭakku of sacred rice offerings.
For the temple priests nampiyār who perform the worship pūcikkum, six nāḻis, one tūṇi, and 15 pots of paddy, which include a side-dish per four pots of rice.
For the temple priests who perform the worship, for those who play the holy flute tirukkuḻal paṇi ceyvār, the garland maker toṭuppāṉ, and the picker of flowers paṟippāṉ for the garland of the idol tiruppaḷḷi tāmam, six nāḻis, one tūṇi, and 15 pots of paddy, which include a side-dish per four pots of rice.
one pot of paddy and one tūṇi for the mendicants āṇṭārkaḷ who live in the sacred street.
two tūṇis of paddy and one patakku for the four nāḻis are to be fixed to the sacred oil lamp tiruviḷakkeṇṇai.
four pots of paddy for the singers of holy hymns tiruppatiyam pāṭuvōr and the dancers naṭṭuvaṟ.
one tūṇi of cooked rice pataṟku at the rate of (?) of two pots of paddy seeds.
after taking one tūṇi of cooked rice pataṟku for themselves (?).
This donation is to be implemented under the protection of the Śaiva devotees paṉma ecuvar.
